pullRequest.body:
We prove [BGR, Proposition 1.2.1/2] : given a nonzero additive group seminorm on a commutative ring `R` such that for some positive `c : ℝ` and every `x y : R`, the inequality `f (x * y) ≤ c * f x * f y)` is satisfied, we create a ring seminorm on `R`.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

Thank you very much for these changes, Patrick!
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9988577100/job/27605367502)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9988577100/job/27605367203)

I was writing a review but I started editing the file to check that some remark was correct and ended up rewriting a lot. So I pushed a commit that you should feel free to revert if you don’t like it (my original review now appears as outdated comments). 

The change is to replace all `(f_mul : ∃ c > 0, ∀ x y, f (x * y) ≤ c * f x * f y)` by `{c : ℝ} (f_mul : ∀ x y, f (x * y) ≤ c * f x * f y)`. In particular the positivity of `c` never play any role, although this requires a proof in two successive lemma (hence the new `seminormFromBounded_aux`).
Could you refer to the references sections here? It isn’t clear at this stage whether you expect readers to know what is [BGR].
I added the link.

```suggestion
variable {R : Type*} [CommRing R] (f : R → ℝ)
```

```suggestion
def seminormFromBounded' : R → ℝ := fun x => iSup fun y : R ↦ f (x * y) / f y
```

```suggestion
    (f_mul : ∃ c > 0, ∀ x y : R, f (x * y) ≤ c * f x * f y) : f 1 ≠ 0 := by
```

This assumption has a weird shape. Why not having `{c : ℝ} (f_mul : ∀ x y : R, f (x * y) ≤ c * f x * f y)`? I checked that replacing all the `f_mul` in this file does nothing but simplifying proofs. In particular positivity of `c` never plays any role.

```suggestion
  exact hz <| (hxy z).antisymm (f_nonneg z)
```
This is not mandatory, and appears elsewhere.
All those `MulZeroClass.` should be useless (here and everywhere else in the file).

```suggestion
  have h1 : f 1 ≠ 0 := map_one_ne_zero (Function.ne_iff.mpr ⟨x, hfx⟩) f_nonneg f_mul
  intro hxn
  have : f 1 ≤ 0 := by simpa [← mul_pow, hxn] using f_mul (x ^ n) (hx.unit⁻¹ ^ n)
  exact h1 <| this.antisymm (f_nonneg 1)
```
I was initially unhappy that the intermediate goal `f 1 ≤ 0` was not appearing in the goal. Trying to rewrite a proof making this goal explicit turned into an unplanned golfing exercise.

```suggestion
  replace hxy : f (x * y) ≤ 0 := by simpa [hx] using hxy x y
```
Here again you can be more explicit about the intermediate goal.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Analysis.Normed.Ring.SeminormFromBounded): add SeminormFromBounded
